title: Sam Fox's Doughbird now hiring for March opening in Phoenix
text:
Doughbird is Sam Fox's 16th restaurant brand, his first since launching Flower Child in 2014. Jobs fairs will be held to hire 120 employees in anticipation of the March 28 launch. The kitchen inside Doughbird. On the menu at the casual, full-service establishment will be a rotating selection of roasted meats and eclectic pizzas for both dine-in and carryout. (Photo: Courtesy Fox Restaurant Concepts) 
81 CONNECT TWEET 50 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Sam Fox fans can mark their calendars: Doughbird Pizza & Rotisserie has an opening date.
Unveiled to the public in September , the restaurant will open at the southwest corner of Indian School Road and 44th Street in Phoenix on Tuesday, March 28.
This is an eventful month for Fox. Just last week, the James Beard Foundation announced he was nominated for Outstanding Restaurateur for the 10th year in a row. Doughbird is his 16th restaurant brand — his first since launching Flower Child in 2014 .
Doughbird Pizza & Rotisserie When: Opens Tuesday, March 28.
Where: 4385 E. Indian School Road, Phoenix.
Details: eatdoughbird.com .
Job applicants: Visit during job fair hours 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Monday-Saturday, Feb. 27-March 4; 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Monday-Saturday, March 6-11; or apply at doughbird.recruiterbox.com 
A casual, full-service establishment with a menu centered on a rotating selection of roasted meats and eclectic pizzas, Doughbird is positioning itself as an affordable, laid-back experience for both dine-in and carryout.
As the gleaming white building with a “Northern California vibe” nears completion, Fox Restaurant Concepts is putting the final touches on the menu and preparing to hire 120 employees. Job fairs are scheduled for:

10 a.m.-6 p.m. Monday-Saturday, Feb. 27-March 4. 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Monday-Saturday, March 6-11. Though the menu was initially envisioned as a mashup between creative pizzas and rotisserie chicken, Fox has since decided that Doughbird isn’t just for the birds.
Restaurateur Sam Fox of Fox Restaurant Concepts.   (Photo: Fox Restaurant Concepts) 
"We bought two big rotisseries and we've been playing around with them, and one day we threw a prime rib on there and it was amazing, so we tried a bunch of other things," Fox told The Republic on Thursday.
This means that other meats and even rotisserie cauliflower will be joining the chickens alongside pizzas like pastrami with aged Gruyere and kale, or spiral ham with spicy pineapple and Thai basil.
As the menu pulls into focus, Fox’s culinary team also has unveiled some cocktails, starters and desserts.
Alongside beer and wine, the bar will serve a signature gin and tonic with a touch of mint and Amaro Montenegro, while the “Afternoon Tea” combines peach and green mango tea with Aperol and clover honey.
To bracket the main event, diners can start with baked Buffalo chicken wings or truffle cheese stromboli and finish with warm butterscotch cream cake, or a parfait of peanut butter, chocolate, banana and bacon fittingly titled “The Elvis.”
Patrons can dine while enjoying an exterior view through a wall of windows at Doughbird, at the southwest corner of Indian School Road and 44th Street, in Phoenix's Arcadia area.   (Photo: Courtesy Fox Restaurant Concepts) 
It's an approach that has served Fox well; adding a touch of interest to familiar dishes.
"These are simple, great flavors that everyone knows," he said. "We're just doing them in a little bit of a different way."
Details: 4385 E. Indian School Road, Phoenix. eatdoughbird.com . Job applicants should visit during job fair hours or apply at doughbird.recruiterbox.com .
